primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: Jesus intervenes in the chaos of the storm and the spiritual alienation of humanity to reconcile them to God through His own sacrifice.

tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus comes walking on the water to them
I have come into this world... to deal with the problem of sin
I am going to the cross
He came to bring us eternal life
He came to reconcile us to God

zender.identificatie: The Triune God / The 'I AM' (Divine Nature)
tekstueel_bewijs: I am the infinitely exalted, above-the-universe, transcendent one
so you can be made whole
we need to be reconciled to him
He bowed his head into the storm of divine justice

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin, Death, Alienation, and the 'Ultimate Storm' of Divine Justice
tekstueel_bewijs: the problems of sin and death and alienation
the storm of divine justice and wrath
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just a bad habit but the ontological gap and hostility between the Creator and the creature.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The believer's response: taking hands off one's life and serving as agents of peace.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (ethics) is explicitly presented as a consequence of the primary (soteriology).

voorbeelden_god_subject: Jesus comes walking on the water
He bowed his head into the storm
voorbeelden_mens_subject: They were straining at the oars
She decided she wanted to be a missionary

voorbeelden: You must deal with me on your own terms
They intended to come and make him king
She decided she wanted to be a missionary
helping us understand who Jesus is
He’s the one who parted the Red Sea
He’s going to be able to save us from storms

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'Pouvoir' (Power/Ability) of Christ to act where the human Subject is 'out of their depth'.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From the 'Storm' (S2) and 'Alienation' (~S1) to Christ taking the 'Storm' (S2) to provide 'Reconciliation' (S1).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Christ as the 'Ultimate Jonah' absorbs S2 to grant S1.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; the storm is described as a 'divine justice and wrath' that would kill the sinner.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is deeply theocentric. It explicitly deconstructs human effort (moralism/religion) as a form of 'fighting God' and positions Christ as the sole active Subject of salvation.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: If you say to God, 'I’ll serve you if' ... God is a means to an end.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: He came to conquer sin and death itself.
He bowed his head into the storm of divine justice... so we could have peace.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The sermon explicitly rejects using Jesus or biblical figures as mere models for human agendas.
bijbelse_figures_als_model: Moses (rejected as mere model, Jesus is the God of Moses)
Jonah (used as a type of Christ, not a model for the hearer)
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Jesus is the 'Ultimate Jonah' who does what we cannot do.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Comfort and surrender; moving from 'using God' to 'trusting God'.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic salvation where the human role is 'taking hands off' (passive reception).

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The narrative flows perfectly from the sign (walking on water) to the identity (I AM) to the work (The Cross).
spanning_punten: The tension between God's holiness (I AM) and His approachability (Don't be afraid).

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: He was thrown into the ultimate storm... so we could have peace.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon focuses on the objective work of Christ rather than the subjective work of the Spirit.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Critical; sin is described as 'hostility' and 'fighting God' disguised as religion.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God as the Subject. The 'Opponent' is sufficiently heavy, necessitating a divine 'Subject-switch'.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain current balance; it serves the grace-orientation.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Perhaps slightly more on the 'Savoir' of the Spirit's indwelling.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This is a masterclass in theocentric preaching. It avoids the trap of 'exemplarism' by showing that the hearer is the drowning disciple, not the water-walking hero.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'strolling' metaphor, Greimas shows this stroll is a claim to the 'Pouvoir' of the Creator.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains 'Ego Eimi'; Greimas shows how 'Ego Eimi' functions as the Sender's mandate to the Subject.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'storm' is not just a setting but a 'Heavy Opponent' that requires a Subject-switch from the disciples to Jesus.

volledige_subject_lijst: Jesus (walks, comes, says, saves, conquers, pays)
Crowd (seeks, asks, tries to make king)
appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'Jonah' typology to ground the 'Helper' actant in the substitutionary work of the cross.
